item.description:
Canine Good Citizen Prep/Refresher Drop-In Obedience Class will take place outdoors (weather-permitting), and will cover the American Kennel Club's Canine Good Citizen Certification steps, including loose-leash walking, heeling, sit/down stays, sitting politely for greetings, stand for exam, accepting a friendly stranger (staying still at your side while a friendly stranger shakes hands), reaction to another dog (staying focused on you in the presence of other dogs), and more taught by fantastic, experienced accredited instructors. 

(For complete information on the CGC exam, visit http://www.akc.org/events/cgc/program.cfm.)

Of course, the ever-popular tricks will also be included!  For a partial list, check out http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GPEDwwi4t8g.

A $15 donation per drop-in per dog (cash or check payable to the New England Bully Breed Club), as well as up-to-date vaccinations (Rabies, Parvo, Parainfluenza, Distemper & Bordatella) required to participate. Class will last about one hour.

What to bring to class: dog, 4-6 foot leather or nylon leash (NO flexi/extend-able leashes), training collar or harness of choice (although a regular flat or martingale collar is required to pass the Canine Good Citizen exam), a hefty supply of "heavy artillery" treats and/or tug toy. 

Optional: treat pouch (recommended), towel, and portable water bowl/water (although "community water bowl" will be provided).

You never know what surprises will be in store!

Hope to see tons of you on May 22nd!

Cassie-Leigh Stock, President & Founder

www.nebbc.org
item.how_to_find_us: Gray building with a fire escape facing the street, and bullies in the back yard.
item.why: Open to dogs of all ages, this course will focus of the skills needed to pass the American Kennel Club's Canine Good Citizen Certification. This is a fantastic opportunity to mold even better representatives of our breeds. Includes trick training!
item.name: Canine Good Citizen Prep/Refresher Drop-In Obedience Class
